name: Quick-n-Easy Chicken and Dumplings
headline: Quick-n-Easy Chicken and Dumplings | Bisquick Dumplings
recipeIngredient: 2 cups baking mix, such as Bisquick
2 cups shredded cooked chicken (or store-bought rotisserie chicken)
2 cups frozen mixed vegetables (such as peas, carrots and corn)

recipeInstructions.text: To make the dumpling batter, combine the baking mix, milk and garlic powder in a medium bowl. Stir until just combined. Set aside.

In a medium pot, combine the stock, salt, pepper, thyme and bay leaf and bring to a boil. In a small dish, whisk the flour with 1/4 cup water and stir into the chicken stock. Add the chicken and mixed vegetables. Using a tablespoon or an ice cream scoop, drop scoops of the dumpling batter into the boiling stock. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Cover and cook an additional 10 minutes. Garnish each serving with fresh parsley.

review.reviewBody: We love this recipe! Easy and delicious, and tastes so comforting. It’s a go to for a cold night dinner in our house!
I followed he recipe exactly and the broth is delicious, but the Bisquick dumplings turned out like tough dough balls.  Not sure why.
Fantastic recipe! Easy to make and the family loves it!!
This recipe was delicious, I loved the dumplings! The only thing I’d change next time is to maybe add a little more broth to make it more soupy :)

I just made this for dinner using the online recipe. I did not use low salt stock so I reduced the Kosher salt by half. I used 2% for the milk instead of the low fat. Hubby and I both thought it was yummy. I did add some half n half to the stock but wish the exact amount would have been included online. It was a bit frustrating that The Kitchen recipe (just aired) was different from online. Oh well, maybe I can find the episode On Demand.

This was delicious. However, wondering why the recipe here is different from the Kitchen TV show recipe. I followed Katie's recipe with flour(not Bisquick) from the show. She used 1 1/2 cups flour, 2 tsp. baking powder and 1 1/2 tsp. salt. Then added 2 beaten eggs and milk to the dry mixture. (but didn't say how much milk on the show), so eyeballed it. Added poultry seasoning to the dumplings. Worked great! Would definitely make this again as quick comfort food!

Thanks Katie for reminding me of an old family favorite. My family has enjoyed drop dumplings (we call them cloud dumplings) for over 50 years. We have the rolled ones occasionally, but my children seemed to like the 'clouds' the best. Chicken and dumplings was a regular Sunday dinner guest at our Southern table.
Our favorite dumpling is with stewed tomatoes and bacon though. I always added a bit of cheese to the bisquick mix before adding the liquid. Makes a tasty addition when cooked in the tomato gravy. 
Great Southern comfort show!

I love dumplings in all their variations. Ravioli & tortellini gyoza & wantons, pierogi & keblach, spaetzle and gnocchi. These are all dumplings and I love them all.
What dumplings are not, however, is Bisquick batter dropped into a chicken stock. Yes, your grandmother may have done it that way, but it doesn't make it right. My apologies to Betty Crocker and Ms. Lee,  but Soggy Bread floating in my soup is not my idea of dumplings.

This was really good.  Not being a true Southern girl, I thought it was like Motza Ball soup, but better.  Yet, I thought the dumplings could use more flavoring.  I will definitely make this again.  Thanks, Katie Lee!
These dumplings are amazing! i like adding the vegetables to the broth. My husband simply loves these. They are so light and fluffy. Simply delicious and so easy! Thank you for this recipe.

Katie, thank you so much for this wonderful recipe.  It was just like my mother used to make and I am so happy to now have the recipe.  If you like a recipe that your mother makes, get the recipe from her now.  There were a number of recipes that my mother made that I regretted not getting before she passed away.
This was so quick and easy and my family loved it.  This is definitely going into my week night rotation.
